Ron,

Top and bottom of the tsuba are the sukashi mon of the
Mickey Mouse clan of Higo.

Only slightly more seriously, the kozuka / kogai ana
have the buddhist pole (or baby bottle shape) that I
usually associate with Higo designs. After that, you
need to make the call whether the metal matches to any
other Higo tsuba you've seen.

Odd tsuba. Nice to see it.

Curran


--- Ron Hartmann <swords@...> wrote:

> Hi - 
> 
> I'm seeking some comments on an interesting old
> tsuba in my collection. It is iron sukashi work of a
> very unusual (undescribable, to me) shape and
> design. It measures 70mm x 58mm x 6mm and has
> remnants of black lacquer remaining on it. The
> hitsu-ana pillows are interesting in that hey are
> double-layered, the inside inlay being shakudo with
> a silver  overlaid plate. The tsuba has not been cut
> down so this is its original shape, in my opinion.
> Obviously it has been refitted many times. A photo
> is posted in nihontostudy pictures under Ron STL. 
> (posted under two groups...so one should work for
> you.)
> 
> http://tinyurl.com/2vyzfc
> 
> http://tinyurl.com/2z2u8j
> 
> Any and all comments welcomed.
> 
> Ron
> STL
